result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Jay Botana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $4,550.00 to Wells Fargo Bank, to be paid first.  Then $515.50 to Milwaukee County Treasurer for costs of extrandtion.

Pay DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements after restitution has been paid.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS: to be paid from prison funds and collected by DOC not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health evaluation.  Follow thru with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Anthony D. or Wells Fargo Bank at 100 East Wisconsin Avenue, Milwaukee, WI.
No controlled substances or alcohol.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not previously taken.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Jay Botana

defendant.name: Botana, Christopher Jay

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING commencing 02/11/2015 received and filed. (39 Pages.)

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Christopher Jay Botana not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requestd a date for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Jay Botana in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Christopher Jay Botana in custody.  Michael Lonski for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20. Scheduling Conference scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: ANTHONY D; NICHOLAS R; JORDAN D; GLORIA D; WELLS FARGO BANK 100 E WISCONSIN AVE, MILWAUKEE WI.

Defendant Christopher Jay Botana in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Christopher Jay Botana in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Letter received from an in-custody defendant who is requesting warrant be resolved.  Defendant incarcerated in Colorado.  Copy of letter forwarded to S. Schrader, DA's Office, for action.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
